definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The almanac also noted the days when the sun would be far north or south.
sentences.chinese: 历书里也指出什么时候太阳大偏北或大偏南。

sentences.english: Winter ends, yet of the year I don't know.
sentences.chinese: 山中岁月没有历书记载，冬去春来不知道是何年。

sentences.english: He pursued his hobby of collecting old almanacs for so many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他一直保持着收集旧历书的嗜好。

sentences.english: They used these records to construct a calendar.
sentences.chinese: 他们运用这些记录编写出历书。

sentences.english: According to the Hindu calendar, each year is ruled by a particular planet.
sentences.chinese: 根据印度历书，每一年都由某一特定的星宿管辖。

sentences.english: Other do so on a so-called "good day"picked up in the Chinese calendar.
sentences.chinese: 有些人还要在在中国的历书上拣个好日子，才来动手。

sentences.english: He pursues his hobby of collect old almanac for so many year.
sentences.chinese: 许多年来他一直保持著收集旧历书的嗜好。

definition: variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
variant of 黄曆|黄历[huang2 li5]
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
(lit.) past years' almanac/(fig.) ancient history/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
Observatory or Bureau of Astronomy (official title) from the Tang dynasty onwards
Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
